thread.title: New Hampshire not selected for federal charter school grant
thread.title_full: New Hampshire not selected for federal charter school grant - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: New Hampshire not selected for federal charter school grant
text:
CONCORD, N.H. (AP) - Officials say the state of New Hampshire has lost out on a federal grant designed to boost the amount of charter schools across the country.
New Hampshire Public Radio reports ( http://bit.ly/1PLDlQo ) officials were informed Monday that New Hampshire was not among the eight states selected for the $5.4 million, five-year U.S. Department of Education grant.
New Hampshire was one of 27 states to apply for the grant, offered to help charter schools with startup costs.
The state received $11.6 million in funding for charter schools in 2010, but the grant expired in July.
Officials say the state has only about $600,000 left for new schools.
There are currently 25 charter schools operating in New Hampshire.
Information from: WEVO-FM, http://www.nhpr.org/
